sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A briefe summe of divinitie shewing the plainest way, how a man ought to examine his waies in this life, to the attainment of eternitie : wherein the whole doctrine of Christian libertie is briefly handled, and may serve for instruction of all such as desire to exercise their guifts aright, which are in these our daies very much abused. Downame, George, d. 1634.
[6], 22 p.
Printed for W. Webb ..., [S.l.] : 1652.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York. On t.p.: Published by G. Downham ... Variant of Wing D2058. Attributed to George Downame cf. NUC pre-1956.
=======

Downame, George, d. 1634.
[6], 22 p.
Printed for W. Webb ..., [S.l.] : 1652.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York. On t.p.: Published by G. Downham ... Variant of Wing D2058. Attributed to George Downame cf. NUC pre-1956.
